Package arcade.patch.agent.cell

Class PatchCellCART

  • java.lang.Object
    • arcade.patch.agent.cell.PatchCell
      • arcade.patch.agent.cell.PatchCellCART
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cell, java.io.Serializable, sim.engine.Steppable
    public abstract class PatchCellCART
extends PatchCell
    Implementation of PatchCell for generic CART cell.

    PatchCellCART agents exist in one of thirteen states: neutral, apoptotic, migratory, proliferative, senescent, cytotoxic (CD8), stimulatory (CD4), exhausted, anergic, starved, or paused. The neutral state is a transition state for "undecided" cells, and does not have any biological analog.

    PatchCellCART agents have two required Process domains: metabolism and inflammation. Metabolism controls changes in cell energy and volume. Inflammation controls effector functions.

    General order of rules for the PatchCellCART step:

    • update age
    • check lifespan (possible change to apoptotic)
    • step metabolism module
    • check energy status (possible change to starved, apoptotic)
    • step inflammation module
    • check for bound targets (possible state change to cytotoxic, stimulatory, exhausted, anergic)
    • check if neutral or paused (change to proliferative, migratory, senescent, cytotoxic, stimulatory, exhausted, anergic)
    • step state-specific module

    Cells that become senescent, exhausted, anergic, or proliferative have a change to become apoptotic instead SENESCENT_FRACTION, (EXHAUSTED_FRACTION, ( ANERGIC_FRACTION, and (PROLIFERATIVE_FRACTION, respectively).

    Cell parameters are tracked using a map between the parameter name and value. Daughter cell parameter values are drawn from a distribution centered on the parent cell parameter. The parameter classes have support for loading in distributions to reflect heterogeneity.

    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • PatchCellCART

        public PatchCellCART​(PatchCellContainer container,
                     Location location,
                     Parameters parameters)
        Creates a PatchCellCART agent. *
        Parameters:
        container - the cell container

        parameters - the dictionary of parameters

      • PatchCellCART

        public PatchCellCART​(PatchCellContainer container,
                     Location location,
                     Parameters parameters,
                     GrabBag links)
        Creates a PatchCellCART agent. *

        Loaded parameters include:

        • EXHAUSTED_FRACTION = fraction of exhausted cells that become apoptotic
        • SENESCENT_FRACTION = fraction of senescent cells that become apoptotic
        • ANERGIC_FRACTION = fraction of anergic cells that become apoptotic
        • PROLIFERATIVE_FRACTION = fraction of proliferative cells that become apoptotic
        • SELF_RECEPTORS = current number of PDL-1 receptors on cell surface
        • SEARCH_ABILITY = number of neighbors that T cell can search through
        • CAR_AFFINITY = CAR receptor binding affinity
        • CAR_ALPHA = tuning factor for CAR binding
        • CAR_BETA = tuning factor for CAR binding
        • SELF_RECEPTOR_AFFINITY = PDL-1 receptor binding affinity
        • SELF_ALPHA = tuning factor for PDL-1 receptor binding
        • SELF_BETA = tuning factor for PDL-1 receptor binding
        • CONTACT_FRAC = fraction of surface area that contacts target cell when binding
        • MAX_ANTIGEN_BINDING = maximum bound antigen count for T cell exhaustion
        • CARS = number of CAR receptors on the cell
        Parameters:
        container - the cell container
        location - the Location of the cell
        parameters - the dictionary of parameters
        links - the map of population links

    • Method Detail

      • bindTarget

        public PatchCellTissue bindTarget​(Simulation sim,
                                  PatchLocation loc,
                                  ec.util.MersenneTwisterFast random)
        Determines if CAR T cell agent is bound to neighbor through receptor-target binding.

        Searches the number of allowed neighbors in series, calculates bound probability to antigen and self receptors, compares values to random variable. Sets flags accordingly and returns a target cell if one was bound by antigen or self receptor.

        Parameters:
        sim - the MASON simulation
        loc - the location of the CAR T-cell
        random - random seed
        Returns:
        the target cell if one was bound. Null if none were bound.

        public boolean getActivationStatus()

        the activation status

      • computeProbability

        private double computeProbability​(double antigens,
                                  double kD,
                                  int currentReceptors,
                                  int startingReceptors,
                                  double alpha,
                                  double beta)
        Computes the binding probability for the receptor with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        antigens - the number of antigens on the target cell
        kD - binding affinity of receptor
        currentReceptors - number of receptors currently on the cell
        startingReceptors - number of starting receptors on the cell
        alpha - fudge factor for receptor binding
        beta - fudge factor for receptor binding
        Returns:
        the binding probability for the receptor
